TopicTitle: Well my parents are becoming more strict about school.

Articles.Content:
So now my Computer time is limited from 2-4PM...

This is great...

So I\'m not going to be able to play on the comp as much...

Now I also have to get caught up on 37 pages of a book..(Which isn\'t bad because I read VERY fast...)

Now I hate being home schooled...(Yes I am home schooled.)

I\'d rather just go back to the school where I\'m not learning college stuff..

Unless I can convince them that they are being WAY too unreasonable which is hard...

You should be lucky you\'re home schooled and your parents care so much. Otherwise, what would you be? Another face in a nameless school with the same complaints as you have now. Trust me, this is preparing you for life. Better to be schooled by parents and be prepared. Later on, these complaints you have now? You\'ll look back and see how foolish they were.

-Drakomis

I\'m jealous, the in middle school right now everyone has no intention to learn, they won\'t shut up.

Get your education, be successful, be glad you\'re so privileged.

Your lucky, many people (including me until found my current school) are stuck doing stuff which is way to easy, having to put up with people bellow your intellect teasing you about stuff, bullying, other bad stuff. The school system (much like the medical system) sees you as a number, nothing more, nothing less. All of this is different for me, as my school is open. This leads to some werid ideas (like 5 15-18 year olds trying to launch a rocket to 30 KM up).

But the thing about this post that I disagree with is that they arn\'t being unreasonable. Not in my mind anyway. This laptop I am writing on, I code games on, and do work on it. Only around 2-4 hours each day are spent playing game. Rest on work, travel and other stuff. And you have it lucky. If I didn\'t have this for work, I would be limited to 30 min of internet time (using Internet Explorer) and 30 min of game time per day. Unless you do work on the computer, I can see this as being parenting.
